results.content:
I have been using ArcGis for a few years now at work, and really wanted to learn Python to automate some tasks and get a higher position at my work place, I have tried a few courses and books and none have been worth the money until now!

I am less than half way through the course and everything has been useful,practical and too the point, if anything its a bit too fast paced for me being a complete beginner, but I can pause and take my time to understand everything and fix my errors! 

I can't rate this highly enough it is the best course to get you going with python in ArcGis and I know this will take me levels above where I currently am. Thank you Programming Academy

results.content:
The lecture is very well recorded, the sound is clear. One of the first Udemy course that I finished, 5 stars for the content.

The only thing I wish that the instructor will do a better is to introduce the overview of the problems before he dives into tutorials. I know he uses the approach learning by doing but sometimes he jumps straight to the tutorial telling you where to click without explaining the problems, the situation, what you have, what you need to do, what is the challenge and how to solve the problem.
This makes the tutorial very boring and sleepy to watch.
Maybe this is only my personal view.

results.content:
I have years of python experience using ArcMAP. I used this course to gain familiarization with Arcpy for ArcGIS Pro. I was very impressed with the depth of the course and the examples that were used. This course touched every corner of the Arcpy API as well as helped user gain familiarity with ArcGIS Pro. 

I highly recommend this course for beginners and ArcMAP 10.x users alike if you wish to use Arcpy in ArcGIS Pro 2.x

results.content:
I liked the course that brought my understanding of the capabilities of arcpy to a very good level from which I can go my way. I was thankfull for the short response time to the two questions that I had. You certainly will have not many questions as the course is well prepared.
Half star minus for the following two points:
  * I wished to have a 1 or 2 short introductory
    slides with the tasks and objectives for many of
    the lectures to get prepared and not just be lead
    to the goals while working on the lecture. This
    would also speed up the documentation of the
    content.
  * The ?Australien accent of Graeme Browning was a bit
     difficult to understand in the beginning for my experiences
     in English, which could be improved by more pronounced
     speaking. No worries, one gets used to it after the first lectures.
     Other than that, as a speaker of a German accent
     I strongly support all existing language accents :)
results.content_html:

content.
* The ?Australien accent of Graeme Browning was a bit
difficult to understand in the beginning for my experiences
in English, which could be improved by more pronounced
speaking. No worries, one gets used to it after the first lectures.
Other than that, as a speaker of a German accent
I strongly support all existing language accents :)

results.content: I found this course very useful as a GIS professional developing an interest in Python programming. I have recently completed a core Python course with Udemy and know ESRI GIS well so this course was a great next step for me. It was pleasing the course touched on the application of Python throughout ArcGIS Pro rather than the core language itself (for which there are other courses). Graeme's instruction is clear and concise and easy to follow along to. I would have liked to see more exercises so if you are new to the Python language (or ESRI GIS products) then code along with Graeme rather than download the chapter's code for you'll get much more from this course. Don't be afraid to go to Python.org too to follow up on some key learnings. Something for everyone in this course. All the best. Chris.

response.content: Many thanks for your rating and detailed review Chris!  Adding quizzes and more challenges into this course is in my plan to make this course even more comprehensive.  Watch out for course messages as these are released into the course at no extra cost to those already enrolled.
response.content_html: Many thanks for your rating and detailed review Chris! Adding quizzes and more challenges into this course is in my plan to make this course even more comprehensive. Watch out for course messages as these are released into the course at no extra cost to those already enrolled.

It was pleasing the course touched on the application of Python throughout ArcGIS Pro rather than the core language itself (for which there are other courses). Graeme's instruction is clear and concise and easy to follow along to. I would have liked to see more exercises so if you are new to the Python language (or ESRI GIS products) then code along with Graeme rather than download the chapter's code for you'll get much more from this course. Don't be afraid to go to Python.org too to follow up on some key learnings. Something for everyone in this course. All the best. Chris.

results.content: This is so far my favorite Udemy course. My strength is in GIS, but I am seeing a lot more employers looking for more skill in python which is, frankly, a lot harder to learn. I have dyslexia so learning languages (esp. computer languages) is very difficult. But the number of scripts and techniques in this course create a library to reference and apply to other projects. he instructor was also very responsive to questions which helped me move along and stay interested. I just wish it had more exercises or challenges to test my grasp on what is being taught.

results.content:
Excellent!

As a Python novice mainly capable of understanding/adapting scripts, I would have loved more automation codes with loops (iterations) (for example reading through a list of gdb files)  combined with a set of geoprocessing tools (say 4/5 connected tools as in basic model builders). 

Again, extremely beneficial (time saving and value for money) yet the course requires patience, some personal homework to digest its impressive content!

results.content: I have learnt a few tips and tricks from this course. But the entire experience was a bit passive. All I have done was watching Graeme writing code. I wish there were a bit more exercises so I feel more involved.

response.content: Thank you for rating and reviewing the course Enric!  It is intended that students both watch me writing and using the code, but also copy and test the code themselves.  Your point about encouraging students to get involved by providing more challenges along the way is well taken.
